title: Rosie the Riviter Font
content:
Does anyone know of a font that exists that is similar to the Rosie the Riveter WWII propaganda poster? I have been looking all over but can't seem to find one that is close enough.

Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002141im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Rosie_the_RiveterSm_4864.jpg)
author: jacobsjeff

comments.content: It was hand painted, as was most lettering for posters of this era. Consider [Tempo](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002141/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/linotype/tempo_std_complete_vp/) [,](http://web.archive.org/) [Proxima Nova](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002141/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/mark_simonson/proxima_nova_condensed/), or [FF Super Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002141/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_super_grotesk_condensed/) as alternatives.

it looks like it's based n Futura, but it's more condensed

[http://www.linotype.com/472/futura-family.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150305002141/http:/www.linotype.com/472/futura-family.html "http://www.linotype.com/472/futura-family.html")
neutraface condensed bold? (the a from the alt version)...don't know
